title: no guarda ni importa contraseñas
content: Luego de formatear el año pasado Mozilla Firefox 109 no guarda ninguna contraseña ni importa desde csv. Todo está bien configurado (permitiendo guardar sin excepciones y sin borrar historial); aparece La posibilidad de guardar en cada página, parece que guarda pero no hay nada y siempre pide lo mismo. Al importar csv no importa ninguno colocando: Fila 1 Error: Campo faltante . En about:logins aparece: No se encontraron inicios de sesión Cuando guarde una contraseña en Firefox, aparecerá aquí. El csv tiene el format: "url","username","password","httpRealm","formActionOrigin","guid","timeCreated","timeLastUsed","timePasswordChanged" "http://foro.mundoazulgrana.com.ar","charalmi","coloso",,"http://foro.mundoazulgrana.com.ar","{05220d80-2d17-4ca1-9974-551a9fbd2dd8}","1313262533048","1432398095203","1313262533048" "http://tcmail.telecentro.com.ar","musicmargha","ahgram57",,"http://tcmail.telecentro.com.ar","{70ae3abc-21a4-448e-8e43-fc31893d55e3}","1313813100379","1314242123728","1314121960124" Finalmente tengo un bookmarks.html , el cual creo que inicialmente lo cargué y no anduvo...... (pero si lo cargo perderé lo que ya tengo actualmente?) SI entro a una página que está mencionada en este listado de bookmarks e inicio sesión colocando usuario y contraseña alli marcado y puedo entrar. Me colocaron Auslogics Boost Speed, saqué todo control sobre historial, cookies, , limpieza, etc etc y sigue igual. Uso antivirus 360. Proactiva de Firefox no está instalada. Ya ven, no guarda usuario y contraseña (por más que los guarda cada vez) ni los importa.....
creator: charalmi

title: FIrefox won't does not stream all channels of Sling
content: For the last couple of months I have had problems streaming some of the channels that come via Sling when I try to watch them on my Dell Latitude E5450 laptop. I can see them fine on my regular t.v. but now not on the laptop. That's a huge change in the last few months because for years I could stream every Sling channel to my laptop. Since my t.v. does not use Firefox, that suggests the problem is something Firefox has done. Not surprising, I guess. Probably happened when it was fixing some other something it screwed up. Nonetheless, any ideas for how to resolve this WITHIN Firefox capabilities? (And don't suggest it's Sling's fault. Sling streams just fine, thank you very much, in Edge.)
creator: LManross

title: 23 apps of Firefox running in Task Manager.
content: Happened to look in Task Manager, , there are 23 applications of Firefox running. Why ? I have two windows and a total of 7 tabs open. What's up with that ?
creator: rrcombs

title: Playing video from my TV provider is killing my SSD.
content: My cable TV provider (ZIGGO, Netherlands) offers an extra service which makes it possible to watch TV with a normal browser, in my case FireFox 109.0 64b. You can watch 'live' and watch recent programs. Playing live gives only few amounts of harddisk write access. However (!!!) when I playback a recent program, Firefox writes 55 Mbyte/s to 2 caches on ..\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla and ..\AppData\Local\Mozilla. I was stupified when I discovered that 3 hours of watching recent programs wrote 1700 GB (1.7 TB) to my SSD by FireFox (according to Windows 10 Task Manager). This data is produced by FireFox since my 30 days usage of internet was only 30GB. I assume FireFox writes decompressed video to cache or something. I made a temporary fix by using symbolic links from ..\AppData to an old fashioned harddisk, which has a hard time writing, when looking "non live". I looked if ZIGGO installed some kind of plugin, but could not find it.
creator: eofsfifx

title: Home page with dual monitors
content: I run dual monitors with multi-tab Firefox on both--different sets of tabs. How can I--or can I--set my Home Page to all the tabs open on both monitors and have clicking the Home button put me back to those two sets of tabs? I can set Home on one monitor or the other, but there seems to only be one 'Home' slot and it evidently is whichever was more recently set using "set home to current open tabs" (I think that's close to the wording)
